content: the last 2 loops with the new color this way we have the new color attached but the last st of the row seems as if it s completed with the previous one 4 enid s snood by kiki crochet patterns copyright 2023 then make a knot with the 2 ends to secure the st this also helps the loops of the last st to come together 5 enid s snood by kiki crochet patterns copyright 2023 color a start chain 217 row 1 work 1 single_crochet in the 2nd chain from the hook continue by working 1 single_crochet in every st across 216 6 enid s snood by kiki crochet patterns copyright 2023 row 2 chain 1 and turn starting from the 1st st work 1 double_crochet in every st across 216 💡 tip #1 check bottom of pg 3 to see how to work the 1st double_crochet of the row in order to avoid gaps 💡 tip #2 if you do not prefer to start the 1st double_crochet the way i do you can always start with 2 chain and start working from the 2nd st of the row the chain 2 would count as the 1st double_crochet of the row row 3 chain 1 and turn starting from the 1st st work 1 bl double_crochet in every st across 216 7 enid s snood by kiki crochet patterns copyright 2023 row 4 chain 1 and turn starting from the 1st st work 1 bl double_crochet in the next 215 st in the last double_crochet of the row we re going to change to color b 216 💡 tip check bottom of pg 4 for a step-by-step explanation on how to change colors color b row 5 chain 1 and turn starting from the 1st st work 1 bl treble_crochet in the next 215 st in the last treble_crochet of the row we re going to change to color c 216 8 enid s snood by kiki crochet patterns copyright 2023 💡 tip #1 check top of pg 4 to see how to work the 1st treble_crochet of the row in order to avoid gaps 💡 tip #2 if you do not prefer to start the 1st treble_crochet the way i do you can always start with 3 chain and start working from the 2nd st of the row the chain 3 would count as the 1st treble_crochet of the row color c row 6 -
